gurmukhi: bwr bwr hI duKq pukwrq ] kwn prI kl ky Duin Awrq ]3]
transliteration: Baar Baar Hidoukhat Poukaarat|| Kaan Parikal Ke Dhoun(i) Aarat||3||
translation: They cried out in anguish many times and ultimately their consternation was heard by the Lord.3.

gurmukhi: ibsnwdk dyv lyK ibmnM ] miRd hws krI kr kwl DunM ]
transliteration: Bisanaadak Dev Lekh Bimanan|| Mrid Haas Karikar Kaal Dhounan||
translation: When the Immanent Lord saw the air-vehicle of Vishnu and other gods, He raised a sound and smiled and addressed Vishnu-thus :

gurmukhi: Avqwr Dro rGunwQ hrM ] icr rwj kro suK so AvDM ]4]
transliteration: Avtaar Ddaro Raghounaath Haran|| Chir Raaj Daro Soukh So Avadhan||4||
translation: “Manifest yourself as Raghunath (Ram) and rule over Oudh for a long time.”4.

gurmukhi: ibsnys DuxM sux bHm muKM ] Ab su`D clI rGubMs kQM ]
transliteration: Bisnes Dhounan Soun Barahm Moukhan|| Ab Suddh Chaliraghoubans Kathan||
translation: Vishnu heard this command from the mouth of the Lord (and did as ordered). Now begins the story of Raghu clan.

gurmukhi: ju pY Cor kQw kiv Xwh rFY ] ien bwqn ko iek gRMQ bFY ]5]
transliteration: Ju Pai Chhodh Kathaa Dav(i) Yaah Radhai|| In Baatan Ko Ik Granth Badhai||5||
translation: It the poet describe with all the nattation.5.

gurmukhi: iqh qy khI QorIAY bIn kQw ] bil qÍY aupjI buD m`iD jQw ]
transliteration: Tih Te Kahithoreeai Been Kathaa|| Bal(i) Tvai Oupjibudh Maddh(i) Jathaa||
translation: Therefore, O Lord ! I compose in brief this significant story according to the intellect given to me by thee.

gurmukhi: jh BUil BeI hm qy lhIXo ] su kbo qh A`CR bnw khIXo ]6]
transliteration: Jah Bhool(i) Bhaiham Te Laheeyo|| Su Kaho Tah Achchhra Banaa Kaheeyo||6||
translation: If there is any lapses on part, for that I am answerable, therefore, O Lord ! Grant me strength to compose this poem in appropriate language.6.

gurmukhi: rGurwj BXo rGubMs mxM ] ijh rwj krXo pur AauD GxM ]
transliteration: Raghuraaj Bhayo Raghoubans Manan|| Jih Raaj Daryo Pur Audh Ghanan||
translation: The king Raghu looked very impressive as a gem in the necklace of raghu clan. He ruled over Oudh for a long time.

gurmukhi: soaU kwl ijxXo niRprwj jbM ] BUA rwj krXo Aj rwj qbM ]7]
transliteration: Sooo Kaal Jinyo Nripraaj Jaban|| Bhooa Raaj Daryo|| Aj Raaj Taban||7||
translation: When the Death (KAL) ultimately brought his end, then the king Aj ruled over the earth.7.

gurmukhi: Aj rwj hxXo jb kwl blI ] su niRpq kQw dsrQ clI ]
transliteration: Aj Raaj Hanyo Jab Kaal Balee|| Su Nripat Kathaa Dasrath Chalee||
translation: When the king Aj was destroyed by the mighty destroyer Lord, then the story of Raghu clan moved forward through king Dasrath.

gurmukhi: icr rwj kro suK soN AvDM ] miRg mwr ibhwr bxM su pRBM ]8]
transliteration: Chir Raaj Daro Soukh Son Avadhan|| Mrig Maar Bihaar Banan Su Prabhan||8||
translation: He also ruled over Oudh with comfort and passed his comfortable days in the forest killing the deer.8.

gurmukhi: jg Drm kQw pRcurI qb qy ] suimqRys mhIp BXo jb qy ]
transliteration: Jag Dharam Kathaa Prachuritab Te|| Soumitres Maheep Bhayo Jab Te||
translation: The Dharma of sacrifice was extensively propagated, when Dasrath, the Lord of Sumitra became the king.

gurmukhi: idn rYx bnYsn bIc iPrY ] miRg rwj krI miRg nyq hrY ]9]
transliteration: Din Rain Banaisan Beech Phirai|| Mrig Raaj Karimrig Net Haria||9||
translation: The king moved in the forest day and night and hunted the tigers, elephants and deer.9.
